intro: Luisia morsei, commonly known as the Morsei's luisia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and have a distinctive veining pattern. Luisia morsei is often found in rocky or gravelly soils at high elevations.
